00027 template<class char_type, class superclass>
00028 class CXMLReaderImpl : public IIrrXMLReader<char_type, superclass>
00029 {
00030 public:
00031 
00033         CXMLReaderImpl(IFileReadCallBack* callback, bool deleteCallBack = true)
00034                 : TextData(0), P(0), TextSize(0), TextBegin(0), CurrentNodeType(EXN_NONE),
00035                 SourceFormat(ETF_ASCII), TargetFormat(ETF_ASCII)
00036         {
00037                 if (!callback)
00038                         return;
00039 
00040                 storeTargetFormat();
00041 
00042                 // read whole xml file
00043 
00044                 readFile(callback);
00045                 
00046                 // clean up
00047 
00048                 if (deleteCallBack)
00049                         delete callback;
00050 
00051                 // create list with special characters
00052 
00053                 createSpecialCharacterList();
00054 
00055                 // set pointer to text begin
00056                 P = TextBegin;
00057         }
00058         
00059 
00061         virtual ~CXMLReaderImpl()
00062         {
00063                 delete [] TextData;
00064         }

00066 
00069         virtual bool read()
00070         {
00071                 // if not end reached, parse the node
00072                 if (P && (unsigned int)(P - TextBegin) < TextSize - 1 && *P != 0)
00073                 {
00074                         parseCurrentNode();
00075                         return true;
00076                 }
00077 
00078                 _IRR_IMPLEMENT_MANAGED_MARSHALLING_BUGFIX;
00079                 return false;
00080         }

00085         {
00086                 return CurrentNodeType;

00092         {
00093                 return Attributes.size();

00098         virtual const char_type* getAttributeName(int idx) const
00099         {
00100                 if (idx < 0 || idx >= (int)Attributes.size())
00101                         return 0;
00102 
00103                 return Attributes[idx].Name.c_str();
00104         }

00119         {

00132                 if (!attr)
00133                         return EmptyString.c_str();

00210 private:
00211 
00212         // Reads the current xml node
00213         void parseCurrentNode()
00214         {
00215                 char_type* start = P;
00216 
00217                 // more forward until '<' found
00218                 while(*P != L'<' && *P)
00219                         ++P;
00220 
00221                 if (!*P)
00222                         return;
00223 
00224                 if (P - start > 0)
00225                 {
00226                         // we found some text, store it
00227                         if (setText(start, P))
00228                                 return;
00229                 }
00230 
00231                 ++P;
00232 
00233                 // based on current token, parse and report next element
00234                 switch(*P)
00235                 {
00236                 case L'/':
00237                         parseClosingXMLElement(); 
00238                         break;
00239                 case L'?':
00240                         ignoreDefinition();     
00241                         break;
00242                 case L'!':
00243                         if (!parseCDATA())
00244                                 parseComment(); 
00245                         break;
00246                 default:
00247                         parseOpeningXMLElement();
00248                         break;
00249                 }
00250         }
00251 
00252 
00254         bool setText(char_type* start, char_type* end)
00255         {
00256                 // check if text is more than 2 characters, and if not, check if there is 
00257                 // only white space, so that this text won't be reported
00258                 if (end - start < 3)
00259                 {
00260                         char_type* p = start;
00261                         for(; p != end; ++p)
00262                                 if (!isWhiteSpace(*p))
00263                                         break;
00264 
00265                         if (p == end)
00266                                 return false;
00267                 }
00268 
00269                 // set current text to the parsed text, and replace xml special characters
00270                 core::string<char_type> s(start, (int)(end - start));
00271                 NodeName = replaceSpecialCharacters(s);
00272 
00273                 // current XML node type is text
00274                 CurrentNodeType = EXN_TEXT;
00275 
00276                 return true;
00277         }
00278 
00279 
00280 
00282         void ignoreDefinition()
00283         {
00284                 CurrentNodeType = EXN_UNKNOWN;
00285 
00286                 // move until end marked with '>' reached
00287                 while(*P != L'>')
00288                         ++P;
00289 
00290                 ++P;
00291         }
00292 
00293 
00295         void parseComment()
00296         {
00297                 CurrentNodeType = EXN_COMMENT;
00298                 P += 1;
00299 
00300                 char_type *pCommentBegin = P;
00301 
00302                 int count = 1;
00303 
00304                 // move until end of comment reached
00305                 while(count)
00306                 {
00307                         if (*P == L'>')
00308                                 --count;
00309                         else
00310                         if (*P == L'<')
00311                                 ++count;
00312 
00313                         ++P;
00314                 }
00315 
00316                 P -= 3;
00317                 NodeName = core::string<char_type>(pCommentBegin+2, (int)(P - pCommentBegin-2));
00318                 P += 3;
00319         }
00320 
00321 
00323         void parseOpeningXMLElement()
00324         {
00325                 CurrentNodeType = EXN_ELEMENT;
00326                 IsEmptyElement = false;
00327                 Attributes.clear();
00328 
00329                 // find name
00330                 const char_type* startName = P;
00331 
00332                 // find end of element
00333                 while(*P != L'>' && !isWhiteSpace(*P))
00334                         ++P;
00335 
00336                 const char_type* endName = P;
00337 
00338                 // find Attributes
00339                 while(*P != L'>')
00340                 {
00341                         if (isWhiteSpace(*P))
00342                                 ++P;
00343                         else
00344                         {
00345                                 if (*P != L'/')
00346                                 {
00347                                         // we've got an attribute
00348 
00349                                         // read the attribute names
00350                                         const char_type* attributeNameBegin = P;
00351 
00352                                         while(!isWhiteSpace(*P) && *P != L'=')
00353                                                 ++P;
00354 
00355                                         const char_type* attributeNameEnd = P;
00356                                         ++P;
00357 
00358                                         // read the attribute value
00359                                         // check for quotes and single quotes, thx to murphy
00360                                         while( (*P != L'\"') && (*P != L'\'') && *P) 
00361                                                 ++P;
00362 
00363                                         if (!*P) // malformatted xml file
00364                                                 return;
00365 
00366                                         const char_type attributeQuoteChar = *P;
00367 
00368                                         ++P;
00369                                         const char_type* attributeValueBegin = P;
00370                                         
00371                                         while(*P != attributeQuoteChar && *P)
00372                                                 ++P;
00373 
00374                                         if (!*P) // malformatted xml file
00375                                                 return;
00376 
00377                                         const char_type* attributeValueEnd = P;
00378                                         ++P;
00379 
00380                                         SAttribute attr;
00381                                         attr.Name = core::string<char_type>(attributeNameBegin, 
00382                                                 (int)(attributeNameEnd - attributeNameBegin));
00383 
00384                                         core::string<char_type> s(attributeValueBegin, 
00385                                                 (int)(attributeValueEnd - attributeValueBegin));
00386 
00387                                         attr.Value = replaceSpecialCharacters(s);
00388                                         Attributes.push_back(attr);
00389                                 }
00390                                 else
00391                                 {
00392                                         // tag is closed directly
00393                                         ++P;
00394                                         IsEmptyElement = true;
00395                                         break;
00396                                 }
00397                         }
00398                 }
00399 
00400                 // check if this tag is closing directly
00401                 if (endName > startName && *(endName-1) == L'/')
00402                 {
00403                         // directly closing tag
00404                         IsEmptyElement = true;
00405                         endName--;
00406                 }
00407                 
00408                 NodeName = core::string<char_type>(startName, (int)(endName - startName));
00409 
00410                 ++P;
00411         }
00412 
00413 
00415         void parseClosingXMLElement()
00416         {
00417                 CurrentNodeType = EXN_ELEMENT_END;
00418                 IsEmptyElement = false;
00419                 Attributes.clear();
00420 
00421                 ++P;
00422                 const char_type* pBeginClose = P;
00423 
00424                 while(*P != L'>')
00425                         ++P;
00426 
00427                 NodeName = core::string<char_type>(pBeginClose, (int)(P - pBeginClose));
00428                 ++P;
00429         }
00430 
00432         bool parseCDATA()
00433         {
00434                 if (*(P+1) != L'[')
00435                         return false;
00436 
00437                 CurrentNodeType = EXN_CDATA;
00438 
00439                 // skip '<![CDATA['
00440                 int count=0;
00441                 while( *P && count<8 )
00442                 {
00443                         ++P;
00444                         ++count;
00445                 }
00446 
00447                 if (!*P)
00448                         return true;
00449 
00450                 char_type *cDataBegin = P;
00451                 char_type *cDataEnd = 0;
00452 
00453                 // find end of CDATA
00454                 while(*P && !cDataEnd)
00455                 {
00456                         if (*P == L'>' && 
00457                            (*(P-1) == L']') &&
00458                            (*(P-2) == L']'))
00459                         {
00460                                 cDataEnd = P - 2;
00461                         }
00462 
00463                         ++P;
00464                 }
00465 
00466                 if ( cDataEnd )
00467                         NodeName = core::string<char_type>(cDataBegin, (int)(cDataEnd - cDataBegin));
00468                 else
00469                         NodeName = "";
00470 
00471                 return true;
00472         }
00473 
00474 
00475         // structure for storing attribute-name pairs
00476         struct SAttribute
00477         {
00478                 core::string<char_type> Name;
00479                 core::string<char_type> Value;
00480         };
00481 
00482         // finds a current attribute by name, returns 0 if not found
00483         const SAttribute* getAttributeByName(const char_type* name) const
00484         {
00485                 if (!name)
00486                         return 0;
00487 
00488                 core::string<char_type> n = name;
00489 
00490                 for (int i=0; i<(int)Attributes.size(); ++i)
00491                         if (Attributes[i].Name == n)
00492                                 return &Attributes[i];
00493 
00494                 return 0;
00495         }
00496 
00497         // replaces xml special characters in a string and creates a new one
00498         core::string<char_type> replaceSpecialCharacters(
00499                 core::string<char_type>& origstr)
00500         {
00501                 int pos = origstr.findFirst(L'&');
00502                 int oldPos = 0;
00503 
00504                 if (pos == -1)
00505                         return origstr;
00506 
00507                 core::string<char_type> newstr;
00508 
00509                 while(pos != -1 && pos < origstr.size()-2)
00510                 {
00511                         // check if it is one of the special characters
00512 
00513                         int specialChar = -1;
00514                         for (int i=0; i<(int)SpecialCharacters.size(); ++i)
00515                         {
00516                                 const char_type* p = &origstr.c_str()[pos]+1;
00517 
00518                                 if (equalsn(&SpecialCharacters[i][1], p, SpecialCharacters[i].size()-1))
00519                                 {
00520                                         specialChar = i;
00521                                         break;
00522                                 }
00523                         }
00524 
00525                         if (specialChar != -1)
00526                         {
00527                                 newstr.append(origstr.subString(oldPos, pos - oldPos));
00528                                 newstr.append(SpecialCharacters[specialChar][0]);
00529                                 pos += SpecialCharacters[specialChar].size();
00530                         }
00531                         else
00532                         {
00533                                 newstr.append(origstr.subString(oldPos, pos - oldPos + 1));
00534                                 pos += 1;
00535                         }
00536 
00537                         // find next &
00538                         oldPos = pos;
00539                         pos = origstr.findNext(L'&', pos);              
00540                 }
00541 
00542                 if (oldPos < origstr.size()-1)
00543                         newstr.append(origstr.subString(oldPos, origstr.size()-oldPos));
00544 
00545                 return newstr;
00546         }

00549 
00551         bool readFile(IFileReadCallBack* callback)
00552         {
00553                 int size = callback->getSize();         
00554                 size += 4; // We need two terminating 0's at the end.
00555                            // For ASCII we need 1 0's, for UTF-16 2, for UTF-32 4.
00556 
00557                 char* data8 = new char[size];
00558 
00559                 if (!callback->read(data8, size-4))
00560                 {
00561                         delete [] data8;
00562                         return false;
00563                 }
00564 
00565                 // add zeros at end
00566 
00567                 data8[size-1] = 0;
00568                 data8[size-2] = 0;
00569                 data8[size-3] = 0;
00570                 data8[size-4] = 0;
00571 
00572                 char16* data16 = reinterpret_cast<char16*>(data8);
00573                 char32* data32 = reinterpret_cast<char32*>(data8);      
00574 
00575                 // now we need to convert the data to the desired target format
00576                 // based on the byte order mark.
00577 
00578                 const unsigned char UTF8[] = {0xEF, 0xBB, 0xBF}; // 0xEFBBBF;
00579                 const int UTF16_BE = 0xFFFE;
00580                 const int UTF16_LE = 0xFEFF;
00581                 const int UTF32_BE = 0xFFFE0000;
00582                 const int UTF32_LE = 0x0000FEFF;
00583 
00584                 // check source for all utf versions and convert to target data format
00585                 
00586                 if (size >= 4 && data32[0] == (char32)UTF32_BE)
00587                 {
00588                         // UTF-32, big endian
00589                         SourceFormat = ETF_UTF32_BE;
00590                         convertTextData(data32+1, data8, (size/4)); // data32+1 because we need to skip the header
00591                 }
00592                 else
00593                 if (size >= 4 && data32[0] == (char32)UTF32_LE)
00594                 {
00595                         // UTF-32, little endian
00596                         SourceFormat = ETF_UTF32_LE;
00597                         convertTextData(data32+1, data8, (size/4)); // data32+1 because we need to skip the header
00598                 }
00599                 else
00600                 if (size >= 2 && data16[0] == UTF16_BE)
00601                 {
00602                         // UTF-16, big endian
00603                         SourceFormat = ETF_UTF16_BE;
00604                         convertTextData(data16+1, data8, (size/2)); // data16+1 because we need to skip the header
00605                 }
00606                 else
00607                 if (size >= 2 && data16[0] == UTF16_LE)
00608                 {
00609                         // UTF-16, little endian
00610                         SourceFormat = ETF_UTF16_LE;
00611                         convertTextData(data16+1, data8, (size/2)); // data16+1 because we need to skip the header
00612                 }
00613                 else
00614                 if (size >= 3 && data8[0] == UTF8[0] && data8[1] == UTF8[1] && data8[2] == UTF8[2])
00615                 {
00616                         // UTF-8
00617                         SourceFormat = ETF_UTF8;
00618                         convertTextData(data8+3, data8, size); // data8+3 because we need to skip the header
00619                 }
00620                 else
00621                 {
00622                         // ASCII
00623                         SourceFormat = ETF_ASCII;
00624                         convertTextData(data8, data8, size);
00625                 }
00626 
00627                 return true;
00628         }
00629 
00630 
00636         template<class src_char_type>
00637         void convertTextData(src_char_type* source, char* pointerToStore, int sizeWithoutHeader)
00638         {
00639                 // convert little to big endian if necessary
00640                 if (sizeof(src_char_type) > 1 && 
00641                         isLittleEndian(TargetFormat) != isLittleEndian(SourceFormat))
00642                         convertToLittleEndian(source);
00643 
00644                 // check if conversion is necessary:
00645                 if (sizeof(src_char_type) == sizeof(char_type))
00646                 {
00647                         // no need to convert
00648                         TextBegin = (char_type*)source;
00649                         TextData = (char_type*)pointerToStore;
00650                         TextSize = sizeWithoutHeader;
00651                 }
00652                 else
00653                 {
00654                         // convert source into target data format. 
00655                         // TODO: implement a real conversion. This one just 
00656                         // copies bytes. This is a problem when there are 
00657                         // unicode symbols using more than one character.
00658 
00659                         TextData = new char_type[sizeWithoutHeader];
00660 
00661                         for (int i=0; i<sizeWithoutHeader; ++i)
00662                                 TextData[i] = (char_type)source[i];
00663 
00664                         TextBegin = TextData;
00665                         TextSize = sizeWithoutHeader;
00666 
00667                         // delete original data because no longer needed
00668                         delete [] pointerToStore;
00669                 }
00670         }
00671 
00673         template<class src_char_type>
00674         void convertToLittleEndian(src_char_type* t)
00675         {
00676                 if (sizeof(src_char_type) == 4) 
00677                 {
00678                         // 32 bit
00679 
00680                         while(*t)
00681                         {
00682                                 *t = ((*t & 0xff000000) >> 24) |
00683                                      ((*t & 0x00ff0000) >> 8)  |
00684                                      ((*t & 0x0000ff00) << 8)  |
00685                                      ((*t & 0x000000ff) << 24);
00686                                 ++t;
00687                         }
00688                 }
00689                 else
00690                 {
00691                         // 16 bit 
00692 
00693                         while(*t)
00694                         {
00695                                 *t = (*t >> 8) | (*t << 8);
00696                                 ++t;
00697                         }
00698                 }
00699         }
00700 
00702         inline bool isLittleEndian(ETEXT_FORMAT f)
00703         {
00704                 return f == ETF_ASCII ||
00705                        f == ETF_UTF8 ||
00706                        f == ETF_UTF16_LE ||
00707                        f == ETF_UTF32_LE;
00708         }
00709 
00710 
00712         inline bool isWhiteSpace(char_type c)
00713         {
00714                 return (c==' ' || c=='\t' || c=='\n' || c=='\r');
00715         }
00716 
00717 
00719         void createSpecialCharacterList()
00720         {
00721                 // list of strings containing special symbols, 
00722                 // the first character is the special character,
00723                 // the following is the symbol string without trailing &.
00724 
00725                 SpecialCharacters.push_back("&amp;");
00726                 SpecialCharacters.push_back("<lt;");
00727                 SpecialCharacters.push_back(">gt;");
00728                 SpecialCharacters.push_back("\"quot;");
00729                 SpecialCharacters.push_back("'apos;");
00730                 
00731         }
00732 
00733 
00735         bool equalsn(const char_type* str1, const char_type* str2, int len)
00736         {
00737                 int i;
00738                 for(i=0; str1[i] && str2[i] && i < len; ++i)
00739                         if (str1[i] != str2[i])
00740                                 return false;
00741 
00742                 // if one (or both) of the strings was smaller then they
00743                 // are only equal if they have the same lenght
00744                 return (i == len) || (str1[i] == 0 && str2[i] == 0);
00745         }
00746 
00747 
00749         void storeTargetFormat()
00750         {
00751                 // get target format. We could have done this using template specialization,
00752                 // but VisualStudio 6 don't like it and we want to support it.
00753 
00754                 switch(sizeof(char_type))
00755                 {
00756                 case 1: 
00757                         TargetFormat = ETF_UTF8;
00758                         break;
00759                 case 2: 
00760                         TargetFormat = ETF_UTF16_LE;
00761                         break;
00762                 case 4: 
00763                         TargetFormat = ETF_UTF32_LE;
00764                         break;
00765                 default:
00766                         TargetFormat = ETF_ASCII; // should never happen.
00767                 }
00768         }

00773         char_type* TextData;         // data block of the text file
00774         char_type* P;                // current point in text to parse
00775         char_type* TextBegin;        // start of text to parse
00776         unsigned int TextSize;       // size of text to parse in characters, not bytes
00777 
00778         EXML_NODE CurrentNodeType;   // type of the currently parsed node
00779         ETEXT_FORMAT SourceFormat;   // source format of the xml file
00780         ETEXT_FORMAT TargetFormat;   // output format of this parser
00781 
00782         core::string<char_type> NodeName;    // name of the node currently in
00783         core::string<char_type> EmptyString; // empty string to be returned by getSafe() methods
00784 
00785         bool IsEmptyElement;       // is the currently parsed node empty?
00786 
00787         core::array< core::string<char_type> > SpecialCharacters; // see createSpecialCharacterList()
00788 
00789         core::array<SAttribute> Attributes; // attributes of current element
